alert.note: Alert for Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 5:53PM EDT until September 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...The potential for flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of western North Carolina and upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, in western North Carolina, Transylvania. In upstate South Carolina, Greenville, Oconee and Pickens. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated developing heavy rain showers along the border between North Carolina and South Carolina. New minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen since Sunday evening. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible over the area this evening, especially locations along the state line. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brevard, Rosman, Table Rock State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Gorges State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Dupont State Forest, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Jones Gap State Park, Devils Fork State Park, Rocky Bottom, Connestee, Sunset and Cedar Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Minor flooding is occurring or is imminent. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
